Introduction to the randgeo package

Scott Chamberlain and Noam Ross

2017-12-20

randgeo is a no dependency R package for generating random lat/long positions, or random WKT or GeoJSON points or polygons.

The benefit of no dependencies is that it can easily be used in other packages without any pain. e.g., you may want to show examples in your package but you don’t want a heavy dependency just for examples.

This package is adapted from Javascript’s https://github.com/tmcw/geojson-random but with modifications.

Install

Stable randgeo version from CRAN

install.packages("randgeo")

Or, the development version from Github

devtools::install_github("ropensci/randgeo")
library("randgeo")

random position

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 63.086639 -1.040944

Many positions

rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 177.03221  54.74135
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] -121.322191   -6.473771
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] -110.3839   89.2258
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1]   1.861492 -42.780232
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] -8.805372 59.594360
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] 147.23023 -22.78298
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] 103.9686 -14.1947
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] -169.91443   70.35534
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] 0.4370622 6.1663878
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] -69.72045  47.48756

Random position within a bounding box

rg_position(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 52.08411 54.57934

Well-known text

random points

A single point

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (152.8838621 -77.7446716)"

Many points

wkt_point(count = 10)
#>  [1] "POINT (-35.1188451 -6.4430549)"   "POINT (-169.6253000 41.9590219)" 
#>  [3] "POINT (40.9500978 23.4051841)"    "POINT (65.5382016 3.4273172)"    
#>  [5] "POINT (-24.7214566 -21.7487607)"  "POINT (-23.1932644 -46.1314371)" 
#>  [7] "POINT (-122.6850555 1.9835428)"   "POINT (-115.0970220 -44.7145838)"
#>  [9] "POINT (-161.3121627 -76.1385941)" "POINT (-159.3459761 66.5419147)"

Within a bounding box

wkt_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [1] "POINT (53.2224805 59.8967058)"

The fmt parameter controls how many decimal points

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (114.9766616 51.7587152)"
wkt_point(fmt = 10)
#> [1] "POINT (-97.6290732343 -12.6655311335)"

random polygons

wkt_polygon()
#> [1] "POLYGON ((175.6680423 -65.8472045, -163.6095896 -76.3472511, -150.7322355 -76.5629123, 170.5533522 -75.6490159, 154.2766919 -80.0969268, 167.0400244 -76.1256488, 164.3493268 -76.1537671, 154.7900481 -72.9651440, 144.1007306 -69.7257129, 166.4857708 -68.1083169, 175.6680423 -65.8472045))"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((119.1983622 85.7462837, 109.3694614 74.0354663, 79.2728766 70.3633358, 72.3570198 77.6731839, 119.1983622 85.7462837))"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((171.3491102 52.9925197, 173.5999529 51.2544989, 174.7509495 51.1528278, 176.2578599 48.5952934, 176.7377644 48.4152820, 171.3890791 48.1462437, 172.0261174 47.5057444, 168.9220796 43.6419306, 167.5679620 44.0250226, 170.9846504 48.9602824, 171.3491102 52.9925197))"

Within a bounding box

wkt_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-117.5207596 59.2177428, -126.0957454 50.8965004, -132.6789872 50.0077460, -130.2365458 51.9602286, -134.0997619 50.3775046, -135.9191774 51.4584330, -138.4255749 51.0609252, -136.1036403 53.1598572, -138.7212404 60.6168459, -128.2650959 57.3578651, -117.5207596 59.2177428))"

GeoJSON

random points

A single point

geo_point()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1]  95.02732 -19.10235
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Many points

geo_point(count = 10)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
...

Within a bounding box

geo_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 55.00602 54.70969
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

random polygons

geo_polygon()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] 146.688503  -4.207448
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] 145.386965  -6.187097
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] 146.185942  -8.446509
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] 139.998295  -7.462348
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] 137.374473  -7.139019
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] 139.227916  -2.034924
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] 131.08336  -2.98984
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1] 133.983167  -1.804578
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]
#> [1] 138.31881  -1.29178
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[10]]
#> [1] 135.830767   1.598067
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[11]]
#> [1] 146.688503  -4.207448
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#>

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -15.39141 -18.38475
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -20.44193 -20.26774
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] -23.77858 -22.52866
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -25.81000 -19.36761
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] -15.39141 -18.38475
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> NULL
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "geo_list"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)

#>
